611. Judy Elizabeth HENDERSON

OTHER NOTES HAVE DEATH 15 JUL 1951
TOMBSTONE
FRANCES REECE

OTHER NOTES HAVE DEATH 15 JUL 1951
TOMBSTONE
FRANCES REECE
------
JER was the dau of GW & MPH. Her husb, Larkin was the s of Jasper and Rebecca.
All of the ch were b in Quebec.

Judy Elizabeth and Larkin were md at the home of her parents, GW and MPH on the
evening of 5 Jan 1888.
Officiating was LM Galazener, JP. wit were JD Galloway, Jack Whitmire and Mark
Whitmire.
The first home of this couple was a five room log and frame house, about 1/4
mile from the present Oak Grove Ch. Here they operated a smoall store, as well
as Tip Top PO. They lived here about 9 years, by that time a large frame house
was constructed for them in a more suitable location on their property. Here
they cont operating a store and PO as well as famming, lumbering and raising
cattle.
Because of their deep interest in church and schools, the home of this couple
was headquarters for the weekly visit of the circuit pastor aws well as
boarding the teachers.
No one could have been more industurious or dedicated than these two who
untertook the task of educating thiir 8 children who lived to maturity. Of the
8, 7 attended college and taught schools for a number of years.
It was indeed a wonderful heritage for those reared in this Christian home,
which encouragement to recompense for the hardships and sacrifices maed.

Judy Elizabeth and Larkin had eleven grandsons in WWII. She kept up with each
of them throug correspondence. Some served in France Germany, Italy and many
foreign lands. All came badk alive.

Larkin Erastus REECE

SON OF JASPER AND REBECCA REECE. PETRUCELLI NOTES HAVE DEATH 6 DEC 1921
TOMBSTONE
FRANCES REECE
----

1603. Frances Lucille HENDERSON

Inb Memoriam - Little Frances Lucille, daughter of W B and Mrs Sue M Henderson
died at her uncles, James Bowlin, in South Carolina last Friday night. She
dieed very suddenly of abscess of the brain. She was three years old last
November, a very bright, sweet little daughter. Her mother wnet over there to
see her sick brothe, and carried her little daughter, never to return again to
their beautiful home at Quebec. The mother broutht her little body home
Saturday night in a private conveyance, and she was buried Sunday evening in
Oak Grove Cemetery by the side of her little brother.

The funeral services were conducted by the writer, their pastor. She leaves an
affectionate father and mother and one little brother to mourn their
irreparable loss. May this thought ever cheer and comfort their hearts; that
their sweet little rosebud has been transplanted from this unpropitious soil of
earth to the Paradise of God, where she will ever bloom in that bright world
where sin and death never enter. F M Jordan, March 12th 1907. (From Sylvan
book Vol 1 p 37) in RHH files.

614. James Kennedy HENDERSON Rev

ON 1880 CENSUS HE WAS LISTED AS J. C.(CANADA)

DIED IN CHILDBIRTH
J K Henderson Married - The following from the Scotland Neck Commonwealth will
be read with interest by friends of J K Henderson in this county. He was
married on Tuesday, June 4 to Miss Helen C Perry: The bride, daughter, of J A
Perry and the late mary Fowle Perry is a member of the one of the oldest and
most distinguished families of the state, being a niece of the late Governor
Fowle. She is a young woman of rare girts?, the former lady principal of
Faircloth Hall at the Baptist University at Raleigh. Her charming personality,
her unselfish christian spirit, totehter with her bright disposition, have won
for her, a large circle of friends throughout the state. A young woman of
Culture and refinement, she is especially fitted for her lif's work. The
groom, a graduate of Wake Forest College and a student of the Theological
Seminary, is a young minister of ability, a clear thinker and an earnest
speaker. He is greatly beloved by the people among whom he labors. His
friends here and eslewhere congratulate him upon his fortunate and happy
marriage. (from Sylvan news p 74 Vol 1 in RHH files)

Helen Cotton PERRY

DIED IN CHILDBIRTH
